_header: Sister look that ye be not forlorn
_description: Treble and alto parts of ‘The Bella’

NYPLDrexFr4185.Transcription:
…Syster loke þat ye be not forlornand sey Kytt hath get
                    acl[ ][ ] vnder a thornalak wher schall we then dwellla the
                    bellSyster lok þat ye be not forlornfor þen euery man wyll
                    laȝh you to s[corn]…
NYPLDrexFr4185.Note:
Portions of pages cut away to fit as endleaves to seventeenth-century
                    song book.
NYPLDrexFr4185.Editions:
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 427 (extract).
